name: Hotel Abrego

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: Checkin was not friendly, a smile & a warm greeting goes a long way.
reviews.title: A mixed bag..,,

reviews.text: The room was quiet, the decor needs to be bright.
reviews.title: The hotel looked brand new and fresh, though a bit austere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wall colours are far too dark, not enough lighting in the room. Yes the rooms could be sound proofed better, I think the interconnecting doors could be better quality.
reviews.title: Nicely furnished, thin walls!

reviews.text: The room had a very stale odour, the carpet/flooring could do with a really good clean.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quite pleasant. We were off the main street and it was absolutely silent except for the sounds of other lodgers running water etc. The room was nicely updated and although small, it felt large. The only suggestion I would have would be to supply two soft as well as two full hard pillows instead of four pretty but large and hard pillows. When I called the desk they were very agreeable and sent out an older pillow that I was able to make do by squishing down a corner. There was a new sink in the main room in addition to the sink in the bath which was nice as there was room to store things on the sides.
reviews.title: Nicely updated

reviews.text: The staff at Hotel Abrego were courteous and helpful, everyone was so nice. The room was very nice and quiet, large and roomy, fireplace, flat screen tv, and sitting area near the window. The hotel is conveniently located minutes from the wharf and cannery row/aquarium. I will definitely stay here next time we visit and will recommend this hotel to my friends. :-)
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: I stayed at the Abrego after I was unable to get a room at my normal Embassy Suites. WOW- what a pleasant surprise. This is my new favorite place in Monterey. Great room. Exellent service. The breakfast is simple but worth $10 when you factor in that the room rate is very reasonable. This hotel is really a treasure. You won't be dissappointed. My most important features in a hotel are condition of property, clean room and wonderful beds. 5 stars on all of them.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: We chose to stay in Monterey on our drive up from Los Angeles, so we could see a little more of the coast, before going onto San Francisco. We booked for two nights, and enjoyed the whole experience from arrival through to our departure. Happy helpful staff, excellent room, and the walk to Cannery Row was just perfect, that we left the car in the free hotel carpark. The old town is teeming with history, and they have kept faith with the renovations for all the old buildings. We ate out both nights and was again delighted with both the service and the quality of the food on Cannery Row. There was a large choice of places to eat and I think we found the two best ones. We took the 17 mile drive on the second day, and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Must see Pebble Beach and all the golf courses. Top marks.
reviews.title: Historic Monterey

reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about the noise based on some of the reviews that I read, but was pleasantly surprised. Five family members stayed in 2 rooms for 2 nights. Both rooms were very clean, nice, and no noise issues. We were on the 1st floor, and one room was even by the road. My husband ate breakfast there and said the made to order omlettes were very good. My Mom said breakfast was just OK for the price of $10. But overall we were very satisfied and we'd stay again! Traveled south to Hearst Castle and back in a day...no problems.
reviews.title: Better than expected!

reviews.text: For a 3 star motel place, we were really impressed with Hotel Abrego. We had booked a room with 2 Queen sized beds so our room was huge, with a lovely fireplace as well. The walls are a bit thin so without the TV on, we could hear our neighbour's TV and talking. Otherwise, I was impressed. Although the hotel is based on a main road intersection, which isn't very picturesque, it's located a short walk away from Old Monterey and the wharf so I didn't think this mattered very much. We found the reception staff very helpful in terms of recommendations and directions.
reviews.title: Great location and room (comfy beds!) - walls are a bit thin!

reviews.text: The location was not very good, At a very buzy, intersection, My room was overlooikng a car dealer,but My room was spacious and clean. I picked this hotel b/c breakfast was incl. However when I got there Breakfast was $9.?? Fridge room had a wierd vent, it was a hole on the door which,can injure you if you open it from the hole, my door did not seem to have a hadle. Hard bed too, but a clean Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: JUST OKAY!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Although we reserved a room in the main building we were told upon arrival that nothing was available. The room we stayed in was noisy due to the occupants of the room above us walking back and forth and engaging in other activities that made it difficult to sleep. There is virtually no sound insulation between the upper and lower floors. The only thing good about the stay was the price.
reviews.title: reservation not honored and room offered was noisy
Beware - Didn't get to go and now I never will
reviews.text: I had to cancel my reservation 12 days in advance and was charged a $25 "processing" fee. It took the reservationist approximately 10 seconds to give me my cancellation number. That works up to $9000 an hour for her effort. What a great way to treat the customer - NOT!

reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!
reviews.text: Yea, it was in writing, but it doesn't make it right. Who plans to cancel their reservation?

reviews.title: Good location central to Monterey and Carmel by the sea
reviews.text: We wanted to sightsee in Monterey, and the hotel was centrally located for all the places we wanted to go. We stayed in a tower room. I loved the fireplace and the daybed that was perfect for curling up to relax or read a good book. The bathroom had many upscale decorations. We ate at the breakfast buffet, and then dinner in the lounge. The breakfast was excellent, while the dinner was so-so with a server that was not particularly friendly. The rest of the staff is wonderful! I'd go back in a heart beat!

reviews.title: Conveniently Located
reviews.text: We stayed at ths hotel for one night on our way to LA via Big Sur. The one thing we loved about it was that the room was quite spacious with a gas fireplace and chaise lounge in front of the fireplace and large screen TV.

reviews.title: Surprising Find!
reviews.text: The corridor going to the room had scruffy carpeting and was dark and dank. I suspect people coming in from the pools had wet clothing and muddy shoes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice helpful staff, clean and nice decor in room, comfortable bed, good location. What I didn't like: room was very warm and there wasn't air conditioning which is torture for me, the toilet was wobbly, and I had an unfortunate incident where the housekeeping mistakenly threw away a plastic bag which had half a pound of Ghirardelli chocolate, and other candy and snacks that had accumulated over the course of our road trip up the coast. When we told the management they apologized and offered us free breakfast.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room and good service. But... we had problems with neighbors making way too much noise through the night. We stayed two nights and the first night we had people above and next to us who were noisy - walls are obviously too thin and not insulated. Second night we had a group of middle-aged men (who should know better) arrive at about 3am and proceed to shout at each other right outside our door and then proceed to run up and down stairs shouting across the car park as well.
reviews.title: Nice but noisy

reviews.text: First off I just want to say that this is by far the best hotel We've ever stayed at. There is not one complaint we had, and the price was excellent. Honestly, all of the chain hotels need to send employees here to learn how to run a hotel. The minute we arrived I was already impressed. It is in a good location and was easy to find off the highway. The property is very new and looks like it to as it is very well maintained. When we went to check in, there was no wait and the service was unbelievable. Probably the most personable employee I've found yet. She was recommending restaraunts, things to do, how to get there, etc. great job!!!! Our room was upstairs in the main building and was easy to access. The room was spotless and quaint, which fit's this town perfectly. The room is very romantic too with a fireplace, chaise, and a very comfortable bed. There is nice stone surrounding the fireplace and beautiful dark wood around the tv, both nightstands, and the desk. The bathroom was great as well with a stone floor and matching shower walls. The whole room was very modern. Next, the price! I have to start off by saying most hotel rooms in this area (and motels) run about $80-130 per night. We paid $130 for a night, and I would have been fine paying $300-400 per night. Overall, easily the best hotel experience and we have stayed at Hilton's, Sheeatons, Marriotts, Holiday Inns, you name it! Great job! We will be returning
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in main building. Room was nice, a bit smaller than we thought, but ok. Bathroom great, except no fan (maybe not working). Staff was awesome. We did not eat there, chose to eat in town. Only drawback or good point....not near wharf or aquarium or cannery row. This means walking to trolley, taking car and paying for parking. But, it also is nice to 'get away' from it all too.
reviews.title: Terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stop on our trip to California for our honeymoon. We had read all the good reviews online and am pleased to say we weren't disappointed. Check in was easy and welcoming, location is great and rooms are modern and spacious. We were given a high floor as requested and it appeared we didn't have any adjoining rooms. It was very quiet.
reviews.title: A little gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here based purely on tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The room was large and comfortable, with a large flat screen tv, sofa, fireplace and very comfy bed. Staff were all very nice and friendly. Breakfast in the morning was perfectly adequate, eggs, pastries, the usual. Lots of free parking. Conveniently located for cannery row, aquarium, 17 mile drive, etc - we had a car but we got a taxi to cannery row one nightm i think it was qround 10 dollars. Would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Monterey.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here based on other reviews and inn was even was even better than expected.. Well presented property -inside and out. Staff were friendly and check-in/out were seemless. Room size very generous including the bathroom and bed/linen were about the most comfortable ever.
reviews.title: Look no further

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ate supper and breakfast at the restaurant . Supper was relaxed ,pleasant and the food good (vegetables were not hot so not perfect) . Breakfast buffet was included in our package but I think was available for $10 -one of the better hotel buffets and good value. A few minutes from the ocean so no rooms with an ocean with exorbitant rates like some other properties in the area.
reviews.title: Very Poor welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one very nice spot-recommended and quite good value.
reviews.title: Not quite what I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked this hotel through our travel agents in the UK and had a prepaid voucher.When we arrived there was no record of our booking. The reception staff told us not to worry because they had several rooms vacant but she needed to speak to her superior. After a while this staff member came and ignored us, I had to ask what the problem was and she repeated she could not find a booking. Even when I gave her the voucher she still continued to ignore us and disappeared. The other receptionist offered us a glass of water after about 10 minutes. After about 20 minutes I went back to reception to find out what was going on, at this point we were told it had been sorted and were given a room key. It took us about 5 minutes to find the room because it was tucked away down a narrow outside passageway with narrow steps both up and down. I refused to accept this and went back to reception to complain, we were then very ungraciously given another room with better access. This room was OK, rather cramped but after our 5 hour travelling to get here and the problems on arrival we had had enough. The rooms have no sound proofing and you could hear everything going on next door and above. This has nothing to do with the hotel but we were woken at 2.30am by the couple next door having a domestic row which went on until about 4 am when one of them stormed off in a vehicle. Although the hotel has no control over this I feel it is reflective of the quality of the Motel. The hotel is not too far from the town and the sea front and this is probably the best comment I can make.
reviews.title: Great spot in Monterey

description: Craftsman-style inspired guestrooms in warm, inviting earth tones reflect Monterey’s relaxed and friendly style. Italian linens, luxurious bathrooms, mini refridgerator, complimentary Wi-Fi and a wealth of other thoughtful amenities creates guest rooms that exceed expectations. Additional features include a walnut desk and ergonomic chair, a plush chaise lounge and 32 inch flat screen TV. Most rooms include fireplaces. Bistro Abrego serves an eye opening breakfast menu and a locally inspired dinner menu, and there is a spacious heated swimming pool and hot tub to relax in. Complimentary parking.
